item.title: 'Deplorable': Foley Family Disgusted by Political Ad
item.description: The conservative group Secure America Now used an image from James Foley's execution by ISIS militants in political ad campaign.

media:content.media:description: This undated file still image from video released April 7, 2011, by GlobalPost, shows James Foley of Rochester, N.H., a freelance contributor for GlobalPost, in Benghazi, Libya.

item.title: Giants Win NLCS, Will Face Royals in World Series
item.description: The Giants' Travis Ishikawas hit a walk-off three-run homer to beat the Cardinals and win the NLCS and a Series spot.

media:content.media:description: SAN FRANCISCO, CA - OCTOBER 16: The San Francisco Giants celebrate after defeating the St. Louis Cardinals 6-3 during Game Five of the National League Championship Series at AT&T Park on October 16, 2014 in San Francisco, California.
media:content.media:text: Image: NLCS - St Louis Cardinals v San Francisco Giants - Game Five

item.title: Giants Win, Will Face Royals in World Series
item.description: The San Francisco Giants broke a 3-3 tie game in the bottom of the ninth inning to beat the Cardinals and clinch the NLCS and a Series spot.

media:content.media:description: SAN FRANCISCO, CA - OCTOBER 16: The San Francisco Giants celebrate after defeating the St. Louis Cardinals 6-3 during Game Five of the National League Championship Series at AT&T Park on October 16, 2014 in San Francisco, California.
media:content.media:text: Image: NLCS - St Louis Cardinals v San Francisco Giants - Game Five

item.title: 'I Love You Guys': Ebola Nurse Tears Up With Her Doctors
item.description: Pham, 26, wiped away tears as she was thanked by her doctor at Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital before she was flown to Maryland for treatment.

media:content.media:description: Nina Pham chats with her doctors at Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital Dallas before she was flown to an NIH medical center in Maryland for treatment Thursday.

item.title: Helmets and Shields: Hong Kong Police Move In
item.description: Hundreds of police officers, some in helmets and shields, descended early Friday to clear barricades in Mong Kok, an offshoot protest site.

media:content.media:description: Riot police officers line up as they move in the occupied area by the pro-democracy protesters in the Mong Kok district of Hong Kong, early Friday, Oct. 17, 2014. Riot police moved in on a Hong Kong pro-democracy protest zone in a dawn raid on Friday, taking down barricades, tents and canopies that have blocked key streets for more than two weeks.
media:content.media:text: Image: Riot police officers line up as they move in the occupied area by the pro-democracy protesters in the Mong Kok district of Hong Kong

item.title: Joan Rivers Died From 'Therapeutic Complication'
item.description: Joan Rivers died from brain damage due to lack of oxygen during a medical exam, a “predictable complication,” officials say.
item.dc:creator: Miranda Leitsinger

media:content.media:description: Joan Rivers attends the NBCUniversal Cable Entertainment 2014 Upfront at the Javits Center on Thursday, May 15, 2014, in New York.

item.title: Joe Biden's Son Hunter Kicked Out of Navy for Cocaine
item.description: Vice President Joe Biden's son washed out of the Navy Reserve earlier because he tested positive for drugs , it was revealed on Thursday.

media:content.media:description: Vice-President Joe Biden and his son Hunter Biden walk in the Inaugural Parade January 20, 2009 in Washington, DC as Barack Obama was sworn in as the 44th President of the United States.
Vice-President Joe Biden and his son Hunter Biden walk in the Inaugural Parade January 20, 2009 in Washington, DC as Barack Obama was sworn in as the 44th President of the United States.
media:content.media:text: Barack Obama Is Sworn In As 44th President Of The United States

item.title: Joe Biden's Son Hunter Kicked Out of Navy for Drug Use
item.description: Vice President Joe Biden's son washed out of the Navy Reserve earlier because he tested positive for drugs , it was revealed on Thursday.

media:content.media:description: Vice-President Joe Biden and his son Hunter Biden walk in the Inaugural Parade January 20, 2009 in Washington, DC as Barack Obama was sworn in as the 44th President of the United States.
Vice-President Joe Biden and his son Hunter Biden walk in the Inaugural Parade January 20, 2009 in Washington, DC as Barack Obama was sworn in as the 44th President of the United States.
media:content.media:text: Barack Obama Is Sworn In As 44th President Of The United States

item.title: Obama Authorizes National Guard, Reserves for Ebola Fight
item.description: Sources said eight engineers and logistical specialists from the National Guard would probably be included in the first deployment.

media:content.media:description: U.S. Marines arrive to take part in Operation United Assistance on Oct. 9, 2014 near Monrovia, Liberia.
media:content.media:text: Image: *** BESTPIX *** Liberia Races To Expand Ebola Treatment Facilities, As U.S. Troops Arrive

item.title: Body Found in Search for Actress Misty Upham
item.description: A family member discovered a body in Washington state Thursday which may be that of missing actress Misty Upham, police said.

item.title: Teen Gets 7 Years for Setting Student's Skirt on Fire
item.description: Richard Thomas set a gender non-conforming student's skirt on fire last year, causing severe burns, but the victim's family disagreed with jail time.

media:content.media:description: Sasha Fleischman was burned in the incident aboard a bus last year.

item.title: Brian Williams: Sphinx of 'Ten Commandments' Found in Cali
item.description: Archaeologists in a California desert have dug up a giant plaster sphinx from the set of Cecil B. DeMille’s 1923 film, "The Ten Commandments."
item.dc:creator: Brian Williams

item.title: Ebola Nurse May Have Been Sick Earlier Than Thought
item.description: Federal health officials are now tracking passengers who were on the plane Ebola-infected nurse Amber Vinson took from Dallas to Ohio on Oct. 10.

media:content.media:description: A Frontier Airlines employee wears gloves as she directs passengers where to go at Cleveland Hopkins International Airport Wednesday, Oct. 15, 2014, in Cleveland. Ohio health officials aren't sure how many people came into contact with a Texas nurse as she visited family in the Akron area days before being diagnosed with Ebola in Dallas. The Ohio Department of Health says she visited family from Oct. 8-13 and flew Monday from Cleveland to Dallas.
media:content.media:text: Image: A Frontier Airlines employee wears gloves as she directs passengers where to go at Cleveland Hopkins International Airport

item.title: Accused White House Jumper Hit With New Charges
item.description: A federal grand jury returned an indictment Thursday against a man who allegedly entered the White House Sept. 19, adding two more counts.

media:content.media:description: Omar J. Gonzalez after an arrest in July. Police say Gonzalez jumped the White House fence and made it to the North Portico doors before he was stopped.
media:content.media:text: Image: Omar J. Gonzalez after an arrest in July. Police say Gonzalez jumped the White House fence and made it to the North Portico doors.

item.title: Third Ebola Vaccine Gets Cash Infusion From U.S.
item.description: Federal health officials are giving a small biotech company nearly $6 million to speed up development of another vaccine against Ebola.

media:content.media:description: A 39-year-old woman, the first participant enrolled in VRC 207, receives a dose of the investigational NIAID/GSK Ebola vaccine at the NIH Clinical Center in Bethesda, Md.

item.title: Hospital Apologizes to Ebola Victim's Fiancee
item.description: The fiancee of the Ebola patient says she got a call from a hospital executive who expressed "regret that the hospital was not able to save his life."

media:content.media:description: This 2011 photo provided by Wilmot Chayee shows Thomas Eric Duncan at a wedding in Ghana. Duncan, who became the first patient diagnosed in the U.S with Ebola, has been kept in isolation at a hospital since Sunday, Sept. 28, 2014. He was listed in serious but stable condition. (AP Photo/Wilmot Chayee)

item.title: Ebola Health Sleuths Seek Ohio Bridal Shop Customers
item.description: Officials say Ebola-infected nurse Amber Vinson visited Coming Attractions in Akron on Saturday afternoon.

media:content.media:description: Amber Vinson, the Dallas nurse diagnosed with Ebola after a weekend trip to Northeast Ohio, visited an Akron bridal shop, and the shop has closed down as a precautionary measure.

item.title: Ebola Health Sleuths Seek Ohio Bridal Shop Customers
item.description: Officials say Ebola-infected nurse Amber Vinson visited Coming Attractions in Akron on Saturday afternoon.

media:content.media:description: Amber Vinson, the Dallas nurse diagnosed with Ebola after a weekend trip to Northeast Ohio, visited an Akron bridal shop, and the shop has closed down as a precautionary measure.

item.title: Employers Scramble to Address Ebola Concerns
item.description: Experts in workplace law say employers should act carefully to avoid discrimination complaints -- and protect their employees.
item.dc:creator: Amy Langfield

media:content.media:description: A Frontier Airlines employee wears gloves as she directs passengers where to go at Cleveland Hopkins International Airport Wednesday, Oct. 15, 2014, in Cleveland.
media:content.media:text: Image: A Frontier Airlines employee wears gloves as she directs passengers where to go at Cleveland Hopkins International Airport

item.title: Why Immigration Talk in Senate Races Took a Hard Right
item.description: Only an average of 4.7 percent of eligible voters are Latino in the eight states with the most competitive Senate races.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Dann

media:content.media:description: AUSTIN, TX - APRIL 28: A bilingual sign stands outside a polling center at public library ahead of local elections on April 28, 2013 in Austin, Texas. Early voting was due to begin Monday ahead of May 11 statewide county elections. The Democratic and Republican parties are vying for the Latino vote nationwide following President Obama's landslide victory among Hispanic voters in the 2012 election. (Photo by John Moore/Getty Images)
media:content.media:text: Image: English-Spanish Signs Front Election Center In Texas

item.title: Who Is Amber Vinson? Ebola-Stricken Nurse Hailed as a 'Hero'
item.description: Officials say she visited one "retail establishment," where she saw five friends who are now in voluntary quarantine.

media:content.media:description: A man dressed in protective hazmat clothing treats the sidewalk in front of an apartment where nurse Nina Pham, who was diagnosed with the Ebola virus, resides on October 12, 2014 in Dallas, Texas. A second nurse working at Texas Heath Presbyterian Hospital, Amber Vinson, has tested positive for the virus.
media:content.media:text: Image: A man dressed in protective hazmat clothing treats the sidewalk in front of an apartment where nurse Nina Pham resides

item.title: Court Tosses Pastor From Pulpit in AIDS Scandal
item.description: An Alabama judge has ordered a minister who admitted sleeping with his flock while he had AIDS to give up the pulpit.

media:content.media:description: During Sunday services at a Church in Alabama, a pastor admitted to drug use, mishandling funds and having sex with worshipers, knowing he had AIDS.

item.title: Apple Unveils iPad Air 2 and iPad Mini 3
item.description: Apple unveiled two new tablets on Thursday: the iPad Air 2 and iPad mini 3.

media:content.media:description: Apple CEO Tim Cook introduces the new Apple iPad Air 2 during an event at Apple headquarters on Oct. 16, in Cupertino, Calif.
media:content.media:text: Image: Apple CEO Tim Cook introduces the new Apple iPad Air 2 during an event at Apple headquarters on Oct. 16, in Cupertino, Calif.

item.title: Dallas Hospital Chief on Ebola Mistakes: 'We Are Deeply Sorry'
item.description: Via video conference at a House hearing Dr. Daniel Varga, chief of the Texas hospital system that treated Thomas Eric Duncan, apologizes for mistakes made while caring for him.
item.dc:creator: Maggie Fox and Erin McClam

media:content.media:description: A member of the CG Environmental HazMat team disinfects the entrance to the residence of a health worker at the Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital who has contracted Ebola in Dallas, Texas, October 12, 2014.
media:content.media:text: Image: A member of the CG Environmental HazMat team disinfects the entrance to the residence of a health worker at the Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital who has contracted Ebola in Dallas, Texa

item.title: Flight to Recovery? Ebola Nurse Will Be Moved
item.description: The other nurse who contracted Ebola in Dallas, Amber Vinson, was flown on Wednesday to Emory University Hospital in Atlanta.

media:content.media:description: This 2010 photo provided by tcu360.com, the yearbook of Texas Christian University, shows Nina Pham, 26, who became the first person to contract the disease within the United States.
